movie_title: Call centres: Are you talking to AI? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Have you ever phoned up a company and had your call held in a queue? Could AI make this less painful

vocabulary.definition: a line or sequence of people or vehicles awaiting their turn to be attended to or to proceed.
vocabulary.example: There were 20 people waiting in the queue at the bank.

vocabulary.definition: feeling or expressing distress and annoyance resulting from an inability to change or achieve something.
vocabulary.example: I felt frustrated when my computer crashed right before I saved my work.

vocabulary.definition: to take over the place, position, or role of; supplant.
vocabulary.example: Many factory workers were displaced by automation and lost their jobs.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
vocabulary.example: She showed empathy towards her friend who was going through a difficult time.
The constant noise from the construction site aggravated the residents.

vocabulary.definition: to observe and check the progress or quality of something over a period of time.
vocabulary.example: The teacher used a camera to monitor the students' behavior during the experiment.
